intro: Nemophila plaskettii, commonly known as the Plaskett's blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
